tidy.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a room, house, desk etc that is tidy is neatly arranged with everything in the right place
tidy.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: I try to keep the garden tidy.
Ellen’s room is always neat and tidy.
tidy.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: someone who is tidy keeps their house, clothes etc neat and clean
tidy.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Chris is a naturally tidy person.
tidy.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: a place, room etc that is tidy looks nice because everything has been arranged and put in the right place
I want to leave the place clean and tidy before we go.
use this about things that are carefully arranged in a way that is nice to look at
The room was neat and tidy.
a place or thing that is immaculate is perfectly clean and neat – use this to emphasize how clean something looks
a well-kept building or garden is very well cared for and looks neat and clean
a large house on well-kept grounds
arranged or organized in a sensible or neat way
The room was orderly and uncluttered.
tidy.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to make a place look tidy
tidy.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: It’s time we tidied up the office.
I’m tired of tidying up after you boys  (=tidying somewhere that someone else has made untidy).
